div.p: The content:encoded element can be used in conjunction with the description element to provide an item's full content along with a shorter summary. Under this approach, the complete text of the item is presented in content:encoded and the summary in description.

Publishers who employ summaries should store the summary in description and the full content in content:encoded, ordering description first within the item. On items with no summary, the full content should be stored in description.
See the RSS Advisory Board's Best Practices Profile for additional requirements and recommendations.
Ensure that there is a description element preceding every content:encoded elment in an RSS 2.0 item.
